title: Steak Haché
full_text:
Steak Haché
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
5 mins
Cook
15 mins
Total
20 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
pounds
(910g) freshly
ground beef chuck
, preferably about 80 percent lean, formed into 4 oblong or round patties
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
2
tablespoons
(30ml) vegetable or other neutral
oil
Salad or
French fries
, for serving
Optional
sauce
s: green peppercorn,
béarnaise
,
choron
, or another sauce of your choice
Directions
Season patties generously with salt and pepper. In a large cast iron or stainless-steel skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add patties and cook, flipping every minute or two, until an instant-read thermometer registers 125°F (50°C) for medium-rare or 135°F (57°C) for medium. Transfer to a plate and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
Transfer patties to serving plates and serve with salad and/or fries, along with the sauce of your choice.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
